item.content:encoded:
March 1, 1907
Los Angeles

Downtown businessmen are at a complete loss over what to do with the garbage from their operations and want the city to either take it or designate a dump they can use.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“They declare that the Board of Health has refused to let further deposits of garbage or refuse be made at the old dumping ground to the southeast of the city and state that if the city does not come forward with a proposition to locate a new dump, or to cremate the stuff, they will be helpless to get rid of the accumulations of each dayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s business,Ã¢â‚¬Â The Times says.

City officials say they donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know what to do because the local sanitation system is strictly for residential use. The Times says that local ordinances define garbage as Ã¢â‚¬Å“animal and vegetable refuse from the kitchens.Ã¢â‚¬Â As a result, officials feel no need to deal with commercial waste, although they concede it is a problem.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“We can scarcely take care of the garbage we are now forced to collect, one Board of Public Works commissioner says. Ã¢â‚¬Å“We donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t want to take care of any more of it, even if it is hauled to the crematory without cost to the city.Ã¢â‚¬Â

item.title: A Foul Wind Blows Over Boyle Heights
item.dc:creator: Larry Harnish
item.description:

Hanson, who held the contract for removing carcasses. But according to the city attorney, Hanson was only guilty of not abiding by his contract … Continue reading A Foul Wind Blows Over Boyle Heights

The post A Foul Wind Blows Over Boyle Heights appeared first on 1947 Project.
item.content:encoded:
Oct. 12, 1907
Los Angeles

After repeated complaints to police because half a dozen dead dogs had laid in the streets for two weeks, the health department tried to charge C.T. Hanson, who held the contract for removing carcasses. But according to the city attorney, Hanson was only guilty of not abiding by his contract and nothing more.

In fact, Hanson had tried to get out his contract, claiming that he was losing money, but the city refused.

The post A Foul Wind Blows Over Boyle Heights appeared first on 1947 Project.

item.title: White Croaker
item.dc:creator: Larry Harnish
item.description:
Oct. 8, 1907 Los Angeles Health officials and a deputy district attorney have joined to urge the Board of Supervisors to ban fishing within a half-mile of the city

Health officials and a deputy district attorney have joined to urge the Board of Supervisors to ban fishing within a half-mile of the city
